Class Employee

java.lang.Object
Employee
public class Employee extends Object
Represents an individual employee within the restaurant management system. This class encapsulates all employee-related data and business logic including personal information, compensation details, and work schedule information. The Employee class enforces business rules such as: - Name validation (letters and spaces only, cannot be empty) - Non-negative hourly rates (prevents data entry errors) - Realistic hours worked limits (0-168 hours per week maximum) - Automatic weekly pay calculations based on rate and hours This class follows the principle of data encapsulation by keeping all fields private and providing controlled access through getter and setter methods with appropriate validation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Employee

      public Employee(int id, String name, double hourlyRate, double hoursWorked)
      Constructs a new Employee instance with comprehensive input validation. This constructor enforces all business rules to ensure data integrity and prevents the creation of Employee objects with invalid data. Validation rules enforced: - Name cannot be null, empty, or contain only whitespace - Name must contain only alphabetic characters and spaces (no numbers/symbols) - Hourly rate must be non-negative (zero is allowed for unpaid positions) - Hours worked must be between 0 and 168 (maximum possible hours in a week)
      Parameters:
      id - The unique database ID (primary key) for this employee record.
      name - The employee's full name (will be trimmed of whitespace)
      hourlyRate - The employee's hourly wage rate in dollars (must be >= 0)
      hoursWorked - The number of hours worked this week (must be 0-168)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter fails validation rules

    • Employee

      public Employee(String name, double hourlyRate, double hoursWorked)
      Convenience constructor for creating a new Employee before database insertion. The ID will be assigned by the database upon insertion. In-memory usage defaults ID to 0.
      Parameters:
      name - The employee's full name
      hourlyRate - The employee's hourly wage rate
      hoursWorked - The number of hours worked this week

      Retrieves the employee record ID.
      Returns:

      Retrieves the employee's hourly wage rate.

    • getHoursWorked

      public double getHoursWorked()
      Retrieves the number of hours the employee worked this week.
      Returns:
      double representing hours worked (0-168 range)

    • getWeeklyPay

      public double getWeeklyPay()
      Calculates and returns the employee's total weekly pay based on hourly rate and hours worked.
      Returns:
      double representing the total weekly gross pay in dollars

    • getDisplayString

      public String getDisplayString()
      Generates a formatted string representation suitable for GUI or console display.
      Returns:
      formatted String with name, rate, hours, and pay

    • setHourlyRate

      public boolean setHourlyRate(double rate)
      Updates the employee's hourly rate with validation.
      Parameters:
      rate - The new hourly rate in dollars (must be >= 0)
      Returns:
      boolean true if update succeeded, false otherwise

    • setHoursWorked

      public boolean setHoursWorked(double hours)
      Updates the employee's hours worked with validation.
      Parameters:
      hours - The new number of hours worked (must be 0-168)
      Returns:
      boolean true if update succeeded, false otherwise
